LPC17xx Devices
Architectures
Collaboration diagram for LPC17xx Devices:

Detailed Description

This contains the device specific definitions for the LPC17xx microcontroller series.

The following devices are supported:

  • lpc1754
  • lpc1756
  • lpc1758
  • lpc1759
  • lpc1764
  • lpc1765
  • lpc1766
  • lpc1768
  • lpc1769

Pin assignement values specify how to map peripherals to IO pins. The following code snippet shows how to specify pins 0.19 and 0.20 for use with I2C port 1. After the ioctl() call, the port is ready to be read/written.

#include <unistd.h>
#include <fcntl.h>
#include "hwpl.h"
int fd;
i2c_attr_t attr;
fd = open("/dev/i2c1", O_RDWR);
attr.pin_assign = 1; //Use pins 0.19 and 0.20 for the I2C Bus
attr.bitrate = 100000;
ioctl(fd, I_SETATTR, &attr);

The following pin assignments are available on the lpc17xx architecture:

  • ADC0
    • 0: 0.23, 0.24, 0.25, 0.26, 1.30, 1.31
  • CAN0 (Not Yet Supported)
  • DAC0
    • 0: 0.26
  • EINT0
    • 0: 2.10
  • EINT1
    • 0: 2.11
  • EINT2
    • 0: 2.12
  • EINT3
    • 0: 2.13
  • I2C0
    • 0: 0.27, 0.28
  • I2C1
    • 0: 0.0, 0.1
    • 1: 0.19, 0.20
  • I2C2
    • 0: 0.10, 0.11
  • I2S (Not Yet Supported)
  • PWM1
    • 0: 1.18, 1.20, 1.21, 1.23, 1.24, 1.26
    • 1: 2.0, 2.1, 2.2, 2.3, 2.4, 2.5
  • QEI0
    • 0: 1.20, 1.23, 1.24
  • SPI0 (SSP0 in the datasheet)
    • 0: 0.15, 0.17, 0.18
    • 1: 1.20, 1.23, 1.24
  • SPI1 (SSP1 in the datasheet)
    • 0: 0.7, 0.8, 0.9
  • SPI2 (SPI0 in the datasheet)
    • 0: 0.15, 0.17, 0.18
  • TMR0
    • 0: 1.28, 1.29
    • 1: 3.25, 3.26
  • TMR1
    • 0: 1.22, 1.25
  • TMR2
    • 0: 0.4, 0.5, 0.6, 0.7, 0.8, 0.9
    • 1: 4.28, 4.29
  • TMR3
    • 0: 0.10, 0.11
  • UART0
    • 0: 0.2, 0.3
  • UART1
    • 0: 0.15, 0.16
    • 1: 2.0, 2.1
  • UART2
    • 0: 0.10, 0.11
    • 1: 2.8, 2.9
  • UART3
    • 0: 0.0, 0.1
    • 1: 0.25, 0.26
    • 2: 4.28, 4.29
  • USB0
    • 0: 0.29, 0.30, 1.30

The following is an example that shows how to use the pin assign values when opening the I2C. The same approach applies to other peripherals as well.

#include <unistd.h>
#include <fcntl.h>
#include <dev/i2c.h>
int open_i2c(void){
int fd;
i2c_attr_t attr; //for other devices this is spi_attr_t, uart_attr_t, etc
fd = open("/dev/i2c1", O_RDWR);
if ( fd < 0 ){
return -1;
}
attr.pin_assign = 1; //use pins 0.19 and 0.20 -- to use pins 0.0 and 0.1 set this to 0 (See I2C1 above)
attr.bitrate = 100000; //100KHz
ioctl(fd, I_I2C_SETATTR, &attr); //or I_SPI_SETATTR, I_UART_SETATTR, etc
return fd;
}

Macros

#define PWM_CHANNEL1
 PWM Channel 1 (PWM1[1])
 
#define PWM_CHANNEL2
 PWM Channel 2 (PWM1[2])
 
#define PWM_CHANNEL3
 PWM Channel 3 (PWM1[3])
 
#define PWM_CHANNEL4
 PWM Channel 4 (PWM1[4])
 
#define PWM_CHANNEL5
 PWM Channel 5 (PWM1[5])
 
#define PWM_CHANNEL6
 PWM Channel 6 (PWM1[6])
 
#define ADC_MAX
 The maximum ADC value on the LPC17xx.
 
#define ADC_MIN
 Minimum ADC set value.
 
#define ADC_MAX_FREQ
 The maximum ADC sampling frequency.
 
#define DAC_MAX_FREQ
 The maximum DAC output frequency.
 
#define FLASH_MIN_WRITE_SIZE
 This is the minimum flash write size.
 
#define FLASH_MAX_WRITE_SIZE
 This is the maximum flash write size.
 
#define MEM_MIN_FLASH_WRITE_SIZE
 This is the minimum flash write size.
 
#define MEM_MAX_FLASH_WRITE_SIZE
 This is the maximum flash write size.
 
#define __ADC0_PINASSIGN_PORT0_23_24_25_26_30_31
 ADC0 pin assignment 0 is port 0 pins 23, 24, 25, 26, 30, and 31.
 
#define __DAC0_PINASSIGN_PORT0_26
 DAC0 pin assignment 0 is port 0 pin 26.
 
#define __EINT0_PINASSIGN_PORT2_10
 EINT0 pin assignment 0 is port 2 pin 10.
 
#define __EINT1_PINASSIGN_PORT2_11
 EINT1 pin assignment 0 is port 2 pin 11.
 
#define __EINT2_PINASSIGN_PORT2_12
 EINT2 pin assignment 0 is port 2 pin 12.
 
#define __EINT3_PINASSIGN_PORT2_13
 EINT3 pin assignment 0 is port 2 pin 13.
 
#define __I2C0_PINASSIGN_PORT0_27_28
 I2C0 pin assignment 0 is port 0 pins 27 and 28.
 
#define __I2C1_PINASSIGN_PORT0_0_1
 I2C1 pin assignment 0 is port 0 pins 0 and 1.
 
#define __I2C1_PINASSIGN_PORT1_19_20
 I2C1 pin assignment 1 is port 1 pins 19 and 20.
 
#define __I2C2_PINASSIGN_PORT0_10_11
 I2C2 pin assignment 0 is port 0 pins 10 and 11.
 
#define __PWM1_PINASSIGN_PORT0_18_20_21_23_24_26
 PWM1 pin assignment 0 is port 0 pins 18, 20, 21, 23, 24, and 26.
 
#define __PWM1_PINASSIGN_PORT2_0_1_2_3_4_5
 PWM1 pin assignment 1 is port 2 pins 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5.
 
#define __QEI0_PINASSIGN_PORT0_20_23_24
 QEI0 pin assignment 0 is port 0 pins 20, 23, and 24.
 
#define __SPI0_PINASSIGN_PORT0_15_17_18
 SPI0 pin assignment 0 is port 0 pins 15, 17, and 18.
 
#define __SPI0_PINASSIGN_PORT1_20_23_24
 SPI0 pin assignment 1 is port 1 pins 20, 23, and 24.
 
#define __SPI1_PINASSIGN_PORT0_7_8_9
 SPI1 pin assignment 0 is port 0 pins 7, 8, and 9.
 
#define __SPI2_PINASSIGN_PORT0_15_16_18
 SPI2 pin assignment 0 is port 0 pins 15, 16, and 18.
 
#define __TMR0_PINASSIGN_PORT1_26_27_28_29
 TMR0 pin assignment 0 is port 1 pins 26 (input0), 27 (input1), 28 (output0) and 29 (output1)
 
#define __TMR0_PINASSIGN_PORT3_25_26
 TMR0 pin assignment 1 is port 3 pins 25 and 26.
 
#define __TMR1_PINASSIGN_PORT3_22_25
 TMR1 pin assignment 0 is port 1 pins 22 and 25.
 
#define __TMR2_PINASSIGN_PORT0_4_5_6_7_8_9
 TMR2 pin assignment 0 is port 0 pins 4, 5, 6, 7, 8, and/or 9.
 
#define __TMR2_PINASSIGN_PORT4_28_29
 TMR2 pin assignment 1 is port 4 pins 28 and 29.
 
#define __TMR3_PINASSIGN_PORT0_10_11
 TMR3 pin assignment 0 is port 0 pins 10 and 11.
 
#define __UART0_PINASSIGN_PORT0_2_3
 UART0 pin assignment 0 is port 0 pins 2 and 3.
 
#define __UART1_PINASSIGN_PORT0_15_16
 UART0 pin assignment 1 is port 0 pins 15 and 16.
 
#define __UART1_PINASSIGN_PORT2_0_1
 UART1 pin assignment 1 is port 2 pins 0 and 1.
 
#define __UART2_PINASSIGN_PORT0_0_11
 UART2 pin assignment 0 is port 0 pins 10 and 11.
 
#define __UART2_PINASSIGN_PORT2_8_9
 UART2 pin assignment 1 is port 2 pins 8 and 9.
 
#define __UART3_PINASSIGN_PORT0_0_1
 UART3 pin assignment 0 is port 0 pins 0 and 1.
 
#define __UART3_PINASSIGN_PORT0_25_26
 UART3 pin assignment 1 is port 0 pins 25 and 26.
 
#define __UART3_PINASSIGN_PORT4_28_29
 UART3 pin assignment 2 is port 4 pins 28 and 29.
 

Typedefs

typedef void * hwpl_target_ptr_t
 This defines a pointer on the lpc17xx.
 
typedef uint16_t adc_sample_t
 This defines the type of an ADC sample (see adc_read() and adc_write()).
 
typedef uint32_t gpio_sample_t
 This defines the type of a GPIO sample for reading/writing the GPIO (see gpio_read() and gpio_write()).
 
typedef uint32_t pio_sample_t
 This defines the type of a PIO sample for reading/writing the PIO.
 
typedef uint32_t pwm_duty_t
 This defines the type for the PWM duty cycle for reading/writing the PWM.
 

Enumerations

enum  lpc17xx_tmr_action_channel_t {
  TMR_ACTION_CHANNEL_OC0,
  TMR_ACTION_CHANNEL_OC1,
  TMR_ACTION_CHANNEL_OC2,
  TMR_ACTION_CHANNEL_OC3,
  TMR_ACTION_CHANNEL_IC0,
  TMR_ACTION_CHANNEL_IC1
}
 

Enumeration Type Documentation

enum lpc17xx_tmr_action_channel_t

This defines the timer channels. It is assigned to the channel member of tmr_action_t and tmr_reqattr_t.

Enumerator
TMR_ACTION_CHANNEL_OC0 

Output compare channel 0

TMR_ACTION_CHANNEL_OC1 

Output compare channel 1

TMR_ACTION_CHANNEL_OC2 

Output compare channel 2

TMR_ACTION_CHANNEL_OC3 

Output compare channel 3

TMR_ACTION_CHANNEL_IC0 

Input capture channel 0

TMR_ACTION_CHANNEL_IC1 

Input capture channel 1
